gene in each cell is called a carrier. Carriers of an ALAS2 mutation can pass on the mutated gene, but most do not develop any symptoms associated with X-linked sideroblastic anemia. However, carriers may have abnormally small, pale red blood cells and related changes that can be detected with a blood test.",GHR,X-linked sideroblastic anemia
What are the treatments for X-linked sideroblastic anemia ?,These resources address the diagnosis or management of X-linked sideroblastic anemia:  - Genetic
